publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-2515# Richard Baker: Aberdeen Crossrail Project—That the Parliament supports the Aberdeen Crossrail project as an integral part of a future transport strategy for the north east; believes that a frequent rail service with new stations running between Stonehaven, Inverurie and Aberdeen is vital to tackling congestion in Aberdeen and to economic growth in the north east; believes that the project is essential for a sustainable transport strategy in the area and to provide much improved public transport options for residents and commuters; believes that supporting Aberdeen Crossrail will enable even more ambitious plans to be developed for new rail services in other parts of Aberdeenshire; is concerned at recent reports that the Scottish Government and Transport Scotland are no longer supporting the scheme, and hopes that the long-established consensus to support Aberdeen Crossrail will continue.
S3M-2515# Aberdeen Crossrail Project (lodged on 8 September 2008) Jackie Baillie*, Rhona Brankin*, Nanette Milne*, Alex Johnstone*, Mary Mulligan*, Iain Gray*, John Park*, Sarah Boyack*
S3M-2515# Aberdeen Crossrail Project (lodged on 8 September 2008) Robin Harper*, Lewis Macdonald*, Marlyn Glen*
S3M-2515# Aberdeen Crossrail Project (lodged on 8 September 2008) Alison McInnes*

S3M-2515# Richard Baker: Aberdeen Crossrail Project—That the Parliament supports the Aberdeen Crossrail project as an integral part of a future transport strategy for the north east; believes that a frequent rail service with new stations running between Stonehaven, Inverurie and Aberdeen is vital to tackling congestion in Aberdeen and to economic growth in the north east; believes that the project is essential for a sustainable transport strategy in the area and to provide much improved public transport options for residents and commuters; believes that supporting Aberdeen Crossrail will enable even more ambitious plans to be developed for new rail services in other parts of Aberdeenshire; is concerned at recent reports that the Scottish Government and Transport Scotland are no longer supporting the scheme, and hopes that the long-established consensus to support Aberdeen Crossrail will continue. Supported by: Jackie Baillie, Rhona Brankin, Nanette Milne, Alex Johnstone, Mary Mulligan, Iain Gray, John Park, Sarah Boyack, Robin Harper, Lewis Macdonald, Marlyn Glen, Alison McInnes, Brian Adam*
S3M-2515# Aberdeen Crossrail Project (lodged on 8 September 2008) Dr Richard Simpson*
